intro: Wimmeria pubescens, commonly known as the hairy wimmeria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the warmer months. Wimmeria pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
